intro: Osteospermum monticola, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Osteospermum monticola is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
